To infer "The envelope must have been upstairs" from this disjunctive statement, we need to determine if the statement logically implies that the second possibility is true, regardless of the truth value of the first possibility.

However, in this case, the disjunctive statement does not provide enough information to conclude that the second possibility (the envelope being upstairs) is necessarily true. The statement only asserts that at least one of the two possibilities must be true, but it does not specify which one.
